subject: Tennis
Davis Cup
lead_paragraph: An ailing Novak Djokovic retired despite leading in the first reverse singles match, giving Russia a 3-2 win over Serbia in Moscow and a spot in the Davis Cup quarterfinals.Djokovic was leading Nikolay Davydenko, 6-4, 6-3, 4-6, when he quit, allowing Russia to take an insurmountable 3-1 lead.Djokovic withdrew from the opening singles Friday because of flulike symptoms but paired with Nenad Zimonjic on Saturday to give Serbia a point by beating Mikhail Youzhny and Dmitry Tursunov.In other matches Sunday, Sweden rallied to beat Israel, 3-2, winning both reverse singles; and Philipp Kohlschreiber gave Germany the winning point in a 3-2 win over South Korea in the best-of-five series by beating Lee Hyung-taik, 6-0, 4-6, 6-1, 7-6 (1).
